28#ifndef EVENT2_HTTP_COMPAT_H_INCLUDED_
29#define EVENT2_HTTP_COMPAT_H_INCLUDED_
30
31/** @file event2/http_compat.h
32
33 Potentially non-threadsafe versions of the functions in http.h: provided
34 only for backwards compatibility.
35
36 */
37
38#ifdef __cplusplus
39extern "C" {
40#endif
41
42#include <event2/event-config.h>
43#ifdef EVENT__HAVE_SYS_TYPES_H
44#include <sys/types.h>
45#endif
46#ifdef EVENT__HAVE_SYS_TIME_H
47#include <sys/time.h>
48#endif
49
50/* For int types. */
51#include <event2/util.h>
52
53/**
54 * Start an HTTP server on the specified address and port
55 *
56 * @deprecated It does not allow an event base to be specified
57 *
58 * @param address the address to which the HTTP server should be bound
59 * @param port the port number on which the HTTP server should listen
60 * @return an struct evhttp object
61 */
62struct evhttp *evhttp_start(const char *address, ev_uint16_t port);
63
64/**
65 * A connection object that can be used to for making HTTP requests. The
66 * connection object tries to establish the connection when it is given an
67 * http request object.
68 *
69 * @deprecated It does not allow an event base to be specified
70 */
71struct evhttp_connection *evhttp_connection_new(
72 const char *address, ev_uint16_t port);
73
74/**
75 * Associates an event base with the connection - can only be called
76 * on a freshly created connection object that has not been used yet.
77 *
78 * @deprecated XXXX Why?
79 */
80void evhttp_connection_set_base(struct evhttp_connection *evcon,
81 struct event_base *base);
82
83
84/** Returns the request URI */
85#define evhttp_request_uri evhttp_request_get_uri
86
87#ifdef __cplusplus
88}
89#endif
90
91#endif /* EVENT2_EVENT_COMPAT_H_INCLUDED_ */
92
